Inhaled mometasone can cause oral thrush, so it is important to recommend oral rinsing after medication administration to prevent this complication. None of the other options are relevant for preventing complications from inhaled mometasone treatment.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Mometasone is a corticosteroid that can cause oral thrush if not rinsed out of the mouth after administration. Pantoprazole is a proton pump inhibitor used for GERD and does not prevent this complication. Spacer use is actually recommended to improve drug delivery to the lungs. Weight-bearing exercise is not directly related to this treatment. Therefore, oral rinsing after medication administration is the most appropriate recommendation to prevent complications.
